ground_truth_reviews.comment: This `increment_likes` endpoint contains a race condition. Since it's an `async` function, multiple requests can interleave their execution. Specifically, two concurrent requests could both read the value of `like_counter`, then both yield control during `await asyncio.sleep()`. When they resume, they will both write back the same incremented value, causing one of the 'like' operations to be lost. To ensure atomicity for this read-modify-write operation, you should protect the critical section with an `asyncio.Lock`.

title: feat: Add endpoint to count likes
body: This change introduces a new endpoint /posts/like to track the number of likes. This is a simple counter to measure engagement.
